description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Cologne" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Cologne

places.generalDescription: Claudius Therme, located in Cologne's Rheinpark, is a stunning spa offering both indoor and outdoor thermal baths, saunas, relaxation rooms, and beautiful gardens. The facility is designed in the style of ancient Roman Thermae but features modern amenities such as massage therapy treatments. Visitors can enjoy various thermal pools with warm water temperatures ranging from 33 to 37 degrees Celsius. Additionally, there are wellness and beauty areas for complete pampering.

sources.snippet: On top of this, champagne can be purchased for that ultimate romantic experience. The baths themselves wind beneath cavernous roofs of stone and even has a floating pool!
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Cologne

sources.snippet: The Claudius Therme is a public bath facility in the urban district of Cologne, situated close to the Rhine and Rheinpark. It is designed in an ancient style of Roman Thermae, which used to be large bathing facilities in Roman cities. Although Claudius Therme has an ancient resemblance, it is a modern-day thermal complex that offers multiple types of saunas and brine pools.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Things to do in Cologne (Köln) in 2023

sources.snippet: Cologne has a number of nice spas dotted around the city and its surroundings, but be prepared: in Germany, nudity is the norm, and bathing suits are usually prohibited. One of the most impressive spas in Cologne is Claudius Therme, which is absolutely amazing to visit.
sources.shortName: 20 Things To Do In Cologne, Germany

sources.snippet: In the centre of the Rheinpark, you will find Claudius Therme, a luxurious spa with panoramic views across the park towards the cathedral, which offers the perfect place to unwind in Cologne for couples.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Cologne for Couples
Hidden Things To Do In Cologne, Germany

sources.snippet: The Claudius Therme is one of the most popular spas in Cologne, and it offers a wide range of treatments and amenities, including an outdoor pool, saunas, and massage rooms.
sources.shortName: Dates Ideas in Cologne: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Cologne

sources.snippet: If you and your partner are feeling worn out, a spa retreat is the perfect remedy. It's a great opportunity for both of you to unwind, de-stress, and reconnect.
sources.shortName: 20 Romantic Things To Do In Cologne For Couples [January 2025]

places.name: Claudius Therme

reviews.text: I had a wonderful time at Claudius Sauna in Köln! The atmosphere is relaxing and well-maintained, but the highlight for me was definitely the jacuzzi in open air under rain– pure bliss. It's absolutely worth every penny, and I can highly recommend it to anyone looking for a perfect wellness day.

The best thing there are the thermal water pools:) Lovely relaxing water, different temperatures,the hottest is 36°.
Good sauna ceremonies as well, however, you have to book it every time on the touch screens.You can book only one at a time. For example If you book a ceremony at 6 pm, you can book the next one only, after that at 6 pm.
The best ceremony is the "Wenik Aufguss". A special thank for the young lady Fella ( I hope it is the right name), to   be so positive, giving us good vibes and strong energy:))
reviews.author_name: N a t a l i a

reviews.text:
I came for a massage, which was ok... I asked him to focus on my lower back cause I was in pain and felt like he did every spot but my lower back.

Went to the baths after. I did not realize that ONLY the saunas and clothing pool were included in the 18.50€. If you went into the salt aquarium pool (which was my favorite) or the upstairs pool & saunas, you were charged an additional fee. So I thought it was all included.

Overall, I had a nice time but was just surprised by the cost.  I'm assuming that's what the German signs were saying when I tapped my wrist band.

I had a cappuccino which was 3.50€

The massage was separate, but the cost of spas turned out to be 44.30€

places.generalDescription: OX Royal is a restaurant located in Cologne, offering a great dining experience with its delicious food and classy ambiance. Situated by the Rhine River, it provides stunning views of the city skyline, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere for diners. While some dishes like the steak are highly praised, others such as the fish soup and dessert may not meet expectations. The truffle mash has been described as a letdown by some visitors.

sources.snippet: Cologne is a city full of fascinating food options, but if you’re looking for a romantic restaurant to enjoy with your special someone, you can’t go wrong with Ox Royal. This upscale eatery offers a menu of delectable French and Italian fare. The setting is just as inviting as the food, with dim lighting and intimate tables that create a perfect mood for romance.
sources.shortName: Dates Ideas in Cologne: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Cologne

places.name: OX Royal

reviews.text: Perfect meals. Tomato soup, kalamari were both delicious. Fresh seafood pizza was super. Mashed potatoes was simple. Chocolate dessert became my favourite. Prices are average. Definitely recommended

We went to this place because of our American Express dining benefit. The steak is great, but not outstandingly special. Definitely skip the fish soup which was very disappointing. We also didn't like the dessert. The truffle was good, but we personally couldn't really taste it in the way that it would make it worth the price. So overall, if we would've paid by ourselves, this would've been a OK experience where if we would about to come again we would only eat steak without a truffle and skip the fish soup.

We stopped at the OX Royal for dinner on the first night of a weekend trip to Cologne. It's a little way out of the city centre, but easily accessible by tram. I can certainly say, it's worth the little extra effort.

The restaurant is located in a beautiful setting on the banks of the Rhine River, and it offers stunning views of the city skyline. It's got a lovely warm and welcoming ambience, and we were seated in a wonderful table by the windows overlooking the river.

As soon as we walked through the front door, we were greeted with a warm welcome and very friendly service. Goran, as well as all the front of house team, gave us exemplary service – they were all truly fantastic.

The menu at OX Royal features a variety of high-quality steaks, as well as other meat and seafood dishes. I started with the goats cheese salad, which was delicious, and for main course I had the Wagyu steak. The steak was cooked to perfection, and served with a variety of delicious sides. For dessert we shared a chocolate fondant which was absolutely sublime – true chocolate heaven.

I can see why OX Royal has such fantastic reviews on Google and TripAdvisor. The food is excellent, the service is wonderful, and the atmosphere is elegant and sophisticated. I highly recommend OX Royal to anyone looking for a special dining experience in Cologne.

places.generalDescription: Team X - Time Travel, Quantum Magic, and Adventure - Live Escape Room Cologne offers an exhilarating and engaging experience for groups looking to bond and have a thrilling time. The Magical Library room provides the perfect challenge for various age groups, with well-timed riddles and helpful staff adding to the excitement. Whether it's your first time or you're a seasoned escape room enthusiast, Team X promises a fun and memorable adventure in Cologne.

sources.snippet: An escape room is not only fun and engaging, but it’s also a great way to bond with your date as you work together to find clues and figure out puzzles. Plus, the thrill of deciphering codes and finding the next clue will get your adrenalin pumping in no time.
sources.shortName: Dates Ideas in Cologne: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Cologne

places.name: Team X - Zeitreisen, Quantenmagie und Abenteuer - Escape Room Köln

reviews.text:
We took part in the Magic Boom Escape Room in English language.

It was a great and memorable experience, very fun and challenging. I would recommend the experience to anyone as a couple or a small group.

Luca and Frägl who hosted us played their roles exceptionally well.  We were both very  happy with the high level of detail, first with their acting and second with the room we had to escape.

The venue was easy to find with parking 5 minutes walk away. In total I think the experience lasted about 90 minutes.

Went here for a Team Outing. Booking process through the website is quick and easy. The gamemaster's acting is incredibly convincing and the room is fantastically designed (we chose the magic library). This place is quite different to the other escape rooms I have been to, in a good way! Right from the start, you are immersed into the magical world. Don't worry, "Purrsula" (the talking cat plushie inside the room) is super helpful and will give you hints in exchange for mice!
Sadly no photos were allowed, except one of your group once you finish.
100% would recommend!
Thank you Team X!

We had a really great time! The actor was excellent and made a really great effort to stay in character. The puzzles were challenging at times but not too difficult overall. It was also very scary at times - brilliant fun. I highly recommend this if you're looking for fun with a group of friends.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Cologne, Museum Ludwig is a treasure trove for art enthusiasts and casual visitors alike. Once the private collection of Peter Ludwig, this museum showcases an impressive array of modern art that spans various movements including Pop Art, Abstract Expressionism, and Surrealism. As you explore its vibrant halls, you'll encounter everything from striking paintings to intricate ceramics and thought-provoking sketches.

sources.snippet: Placed at a prime location in the city of Cologne, the Ludwig Museum is a major tourist attraction. It is the first museum to start exhibiting modern art in Köln. Peter Ludwig and his wife gifted 350 pieces of modern art to start the exhibition of this museum in the year 1976.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Things to do in Cologne (Köln) in 2023

sources.snippet: Art enthusiasts will appreciate the Ludwig Museum, home to an impressive collection of modern and contemporary art. Works by Picasso, Warhol, and Lichtenstein are on display, making it a must-visit for those seeking a cultural experience.
sources.shortName: Cologne City Guide10 Must-Visit Hotspots

sources.snippet: But if you only have time to visit one museum, the Ludwig Museum is highly recommended. It's conveniently located and boasts one of the biggest Picasso collections in Europe.
sources.shortName: Cool & Quirky Things to Do in Cologne in Two Days

sources.snippet: Even if you're not typically into art, Museum Ludwig may surprise you. My wife and I stumbled upon it, and we ended up spending hours admiring their incredible collection.
sources.shortName: 20 Romantic Things To Do In Cologne For Couples [January 2025]
Hidden Things To Do In Cologne, Germany

places.name: Museum Ludwig

reviews.text: A fantastic museum for modern and contemporary art lovers. Museum Ludwig has an impressive collection; from Picasso and Warhol to Lichtenstein and contemporary German artists. The layout is spacious and well organized, making it easy to explore at your own pace. Some temporary exhibitions are truly thought-provoking and beautifully curated. The view of Cologne Cathedral from the upper floors is a bonus also. It's definitely worth spending a couple of hours here. If you enjoy art, don't skip it while in Cologne.

What a lovely museum; both its architecture and its collections, they are all breathtaking…

Museum Ludwig is highly regarded as one of Europe's most significant art museums, particularly for its collection of modern and contemporary art…

It has diverse collection, which includes extensive holdings of Pop Art, Picasso, and works from the Russian avant-garde…

The museum's architecture and spacious galleries are excellently  contributing to a positive experience…

Its main key aspects are as below:

Extensive Collection:
It boasts a vast collection spanning various artistic movements from the 20th and 21st centuries, with notable strengths in Pop Art, Picasso, and Russian avant-garde works…

Renowned Artists:
You can expect to see works by iconic artists such as Picasso, Warhol, Lichtenstein, Richter, Mondrian, Dali, Kandinsky, Nolde, Kokoschka, Man Ray, Pollack, Miro and many more…

Well-Curated Exhibitions:
The museum is well-organized and thoughtfully presents exhibitions, offering a mix of established masterpieces and cutting-edge contemporary works…

Architectural Design:
The building's architecture, including its spacious galleries and natural lighting, is enhancing the overall viewing experience…

Location:
Situated near the Cologne Cathedral, railway station and the bridge the museum's location is very very  convenient…

Overall:
Museum Ludwig is a high-quality art institution that offers a rewarding experience…

Having said all these, need to mention that some visitors suggest that the museum could improve the information provided alongside the artworks, particularly for those less familiar with modern art…

A fantastic museum with an impressive collection of modern and contemporary art, including standout works by Picasso, Warhol, and Lichtenstein. The layout is spacious and well-curated, making it easy to explore at your own pace. Some sections may feel a bit niche or abstract depending on your taste, but overall it's a must-visit for art enthusiasts. Great location next to the cathedral and worth the visit.

places.generalDescription: Pottkind is a renowned fine dining restaurant in Cologne, offering a fixed menu with an open kitchen, vegetarian options, and wine pairings. It has gained recognition for its exceptional food presentation and flavors. The restaurant's unique concept of not having a menu adds to the excitement of the dining experience. With professional and friendly staff, Pottkind provides top-notch service, allowing guests to interact with the chefs at the counter space. The establishment's cleanliness and attention to detail also contribute to its appeal.

sources.snippet: Absolutely a hidden gem, Pottkind strikes me as a restaurant that could have a Michelin star in the future. From their creativity and flavors to service and plating, everything here is beautifully done. It is so unpretentious too.
sources.shortName: Best Cologne Restaurants For A Date Night Or Special Occasion
sources.siteName: Ausländer - An Expat’s Guide to Germany

places.name: Pottkind

reviews.text:
A Michelin star, and it's easy to see why.

From the moment we walked in, the staff were incredibly attentive. We were greeted and seated straight away. It's a small venue, so attention to the little things is hugely important - and they nailed it.

We were lucky enough to sit at the counter (it's an open kitchen), giving us a front-row seat to the magic. The service appeared effortless while maintaining the absolute highest standards. The chefs hardly spoke, yet everything ran like clockwork - it almost felt like the executive chef was communicating telepathically with his team.

The service was exceptional. Each course came with an in-depth explanation of the ingredients and techniques used. We opted for the wine pairing, which I'd highly recommend - if you're enjoying a meal like this, the pairing really completes the experience. Just like the food, each wine was introduced with thoughtful details about its origins and flavour profile.

Absolutely 100% recommend this restaurant if you're after a top-tier dining experience in an intimate setting.

Michelin Star, but don't expect the typical Michelin type setting.
What is different? It is more relaxed, easy going, run by young guys who are having fun.
What is not different? The prices
What is great? The food is extremely well prepared and well served.
What sucks? Sorry, to say: the wines were selected by amateurs. I know wine is a taste thing, but as a *-restaurant you can't miss on the all-stars. And the ones I had, did not impress.

All in all 7.5/10
Lovely, informal, small-scale. Living room atmosphere with relaxed music. Don't expect an ultra-sleek Michelin atmosphere, but good food with care!

places.generalDescription: If you're looking for a unique cinematic experience, look no further than DRIVE IN Autokino Köln Porz. This classic outdoor drive-in movie theater is perfect for those cozy date nights or family outings, especially if you have your own vehicle. Open year-round, it showcases a variety of the latest films under the stars. The on-site snack bar offers an array of delicious treats like burgers, hot dogs, popcorn, and ice cream to keep you satisfied throughout the show.

sources.snippet: The drive-in theatre in Cologne Porz is an excellent way to uplevel a cinema date – given that you have a car. It’s open year-round and screens a selection of the latest films. The on-site snack bar supplies you with burgers, hot dogs, popcorn, ice cream and drinks, and you can rent portable heaters for the colder months.
sources.shortName: Coolest Things To Do For A Romantic Date In Cologne

places.name: DRIVE IN Autokino Köln Porz

reviews.text:
I enjoyed a movie yesterday there, it was a great experience, good organization, clean, toilets clean and good sound of the movie in my own radio.
Could be great if they give the option to listen the original voice in another frequency.
Absolutely top place with perfect atmosphere .. We are very upset that soon will be this kino closed :(
Best place to watch a movie undisturbed! Good food in the Snackbar. Typical cinema snacks and more!!

sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Cologne

places.name: Cologne Tourist Personenschiffahrt am Dom GmbH

reviews.text: We bought a combined ticket to the panoramic boat tour and the Chocolate Museum for 24€. It was a nice program and good to learn a little of Cologne history.

It was a cold and rainy day on this day.  But as we went on tour with the Kölntourist on midday for 1,5h, rain stopped and even the sun came out!  We bought the tickets in advance for the Saturday Trip 29.07. You can buy tickets also there. Price per person 19,90 = 39,80€ for approx. 90 minutes tour. Skyline Tour. Service is ok. Tour well planned and we enjoyed it. Beverages were ok.
But: having a hen party on board, made it impossible to hear the PA System and was quite disturbing with all the noise most of the time! Unfortunately it really spoiled the tour.

Edit: It is unfortunate to read that customer concerns are not taken seriously according to the situation and are even rather arbitrarily ignored.

They sell "combination" tickets which supposedly include entrance to the chocolate museum. Took 30 minutes of waiting to the side to find out from three different managers that these are no longer honored.

False advertising to the point of actually being a crime.

On top of that the "tour" is horrible. Simply a grainy recording on broken speakers. They oversold seats so tables were not available. Despite this you can't order at the bar as they only serve via "table service". Took 35 minutes and four attempts at the bar before I was able to get a drink. They were quick to take my money though.

Next time I would rather swim in the Rhein with concrete shoes than go on this torture cruise again

places.generalDescription: Phantasialand is a popular theme park offering a variety of experiences for visitors of all ages. Thrill-seekers can enjoy rides like Taron and Black Mamba, while cultural enthusiasts can explore themed areas inspired by China, Mexico, and Africa. The park also features live shows such as the Celebration of Nations with impressive acrobatic performances.

sources.snippet: If you’re looking for unconventional romance, Phantasialand in Bruhl is a great place for you. This theme park is home to a variety of unique attractions, including a roller coaster that goes through a waterfall and a pirate ship that swings back and forth. Plus, there’s even a section of the park dedicated to Alice in Wonderland.
sources.shortName: Dates Ideas in Cologne: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Cologne

sources.snippet: Phantasialand is a theme park and a fun weekend getaway for families and friends. Located in Brühl, it is 16 miles away from Cologne. It is one of the best theme parks in Germany, with almost 2 million visitors every year.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Things to do in Cologne (Köln) in 2023

sources.snippet: If theme parks are right up your alley, then you’re definitely going to want to head to Phantasialand. This amazing park has a huge selection of rides and attractions that will entertain you the whole day long.
sources.shortName: 20 Things To Do In Cologne, Germany

sources.snippet: If you're a pair of thrill seekers, Phantasialand is the perfect day trip to have fun together as a couple. In fact, many fans argue it's better than Europa-Park or Disneyland!
sources.shortName: 20 Romantic Things To Do In Cologne For Couples [January 2025]
Hidden Things To Do In Cologne, Germany

places.name: Phantasialand

reviews.text:
Unforgettable Family Day at Phantasialand!

We had an amazing time at Phantasialand on our family day! Everything was incredibly well organized from start to finish. The staff were all super friendly, helpful, and made us feel welcome everywhere we went.

The food and drinks were not only delicious, but also very reasonably priced - a pleasant surprise for a theme park! We really appreciated the variety and quality without having to spend a fortune.

Another big plus: the facilities were spotless. The restrooms were clean throughout the day, which made the experience even more comfortable for our whole family.

All in all, Phantasialand offered a fantastic day out with top-notch organization, great value, and lots of fun for all ages. We'll definitely be back!

This park is absolutely stunning! I have been to a lot of them but this one is a true piece of art! Wherever you look it is fabulous! The rides are super fun and the food is very good. I want to come back as soon as i can.

It's a nice enough place. It's clean, in terms of no visible grime on things, but the air is filthy with cigarette smoke. The rides are long, with queues to match. I found myself exiting rides, feeling nauseous already, only to walk into a wall of toxic smoke making me feel disgusting. The only place you can go to escape it is the queue of another ride, so that's what we did.
The food is on the expensive side, but there are cheaper options and we took our own snacks to supplement. Recommend doing this if cost is a concern.
A number of rides were closed on our visit but the ones we did go on were good, well managed, no technical difficulties. We didn't check our small bags and they were fine to be stored while we went on most rides.
Agree that the shuttle bus feels like a scam. €5 for a return trip when you have to wait 30 min for it feels excessive.
I tried it, I didn't vomit, I probably wouldn't return.

places.generalDescription: Cologne Cathedral, a stunning example of Gothic architecture, stands as a majestic landmark in the heart of Cologne. Its grand facade is just the beginning; visitors can embark on guided tours that not only delve into its rich history but also offer breathtaking views of the Rhine River. The vibrant city surrounding this iconic cathedral is alive with culture and charm, from medieval markets to lively carnival celebrations.

sources.snippet: Of course the most outstanding highlights are Cologne Cathedral and the city’s 12 famous Romanesque churches. One good thing about Cologne is that you can combine visits to many highlights, monuments, hotspots and museums by simply walking around — for example, from the Cathedral through the Altstadt (Old Town) to the Rheinauhafen (Rheinau Harbour) district and back along the Rhine. Or you can visit the Zoo and the Flora botanical garden, cross the Rhine in a cable car and walk back along the right bank, crossing the Rhine again to the Cathedral via the Hohenzollernbrücke with its load of “love locks” weighing many tonnes.
sources.shortName: Cologne sights: the most important destinations

sources.snippet: This Gothic masterpiece is not only an impressive architectural wonder, but also offers an incredibly romantic view of the city. A walk through the alleyways around the cathedral at sunset, when the last rays of the day bathe the building in a golden light, is an unforgettable experience.
sources.shortName: The 8 most romantic corners of Cologne

sources.snippet: This huge cathedral is remarkably the most visited landmark in the country. Its twin spires dominate the Cologne skyline, and you´re going to want to take a trip to the top for the breathtaking panoramic views of the city below.
sources.shortName: 20 Things To Do In Cologne, Germany

sources.snippet: From the awe-inspiring Cologne Cathedral to the laid-back charm of Rheinauhafen, this city has something for everyone. Join us as we explore the top 10 must-visit spots, adding a touch of zest to your Cologne experience.
sources.shortName: Cologne City Guide10 Must-Visit Hotspots

sources.snippet: Cologne is home to twelve Romanesque Churches from the Middle Ages. However, the magnificent Gothic Cologne Cathedral, or Kölner Domand, is a sight not to be missed.
sources.shortName: Cool & Quirky Things to Do in Cologne in Two Days

sources.snippet: Book the Cathedral and Old Town tour in Cologne and enjoy a delicious Kölsch beer. Let your city guide tell you all about the long history of Cologne.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Cologne : Museums and attractions
20 Romantic Things To Do In Cologne For Couples [January 2025]

places.name: Cologne Cathedral

reviews.text: Breathtaking . It's so large inside that it's hard to comprehend without being here. It would be nice to see what it would look like after the outside was acid washed or something but the inside is pristine. Curious how old the stained glass is. Not the slightest bit of fading . It's interesting how the year of completion is viewable as you climb the stairs to the top of the south viewing tower .

Absolutely stunning. The inside is free to enter. It's a church so be quiet and respectful. We got to hear a live performance of the piano and organs which was beautiful. Walk the tower for €6. The steps are 533 up and back down. It's physical and small space with some inlets to stop to rest but worth it. I'm terrified of heights but did it. They are down the steps to the side of the cathedral near the paid toilets. You can use credit cards or cash for both the tour and toilet.

A must visit place on the city of Cologne. It does not matter your religious beliefs, this great and awesome work of architecture inside and out is more than a masterpiece. Take your time to see in depth every single detail inside. It is worth the time. No visit to Cologne is complete without going to this cathedral.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Cologne, the Cologne Zoological Garden is a historic gem that has been captivating visitors since its establishment in 1860. This long-standing zoo boasts an impressive collection of over 10,000 animals representing more than 850 species. Among its many attractions are a stunning elephant park—the largest in Northern Europe—an engaging aquarium, and a lush rainforest house that transports you to exotic locales.

sources.snippet: Or you can visit the Zoo and the Flora botanical garden, cross the Rhine in a cable car and walk back along the right bank, crossing the Rhine again to the Cathedral via the Hohenzollernbrücke with its load of “love locks” weighing many tonnes. Cologne is a green metropolis with many attractive parks and gardens that offer pleasant opportunities to relax after gathering so many new impressions.
sources.shortName: Cologne sights: the most important destinations

sources.snippet: Founded in 1860, the Köln Zoo is one of the oldest yet very modern style of zoo in Cologne. The zoological garden is located very close to the river Rhine and 1.8 miles northeast of the Cologne Cathedral. If you’re an animal enthusiast, you should visit the Köln Zoo for its 10,000 animals and 820 species spread over a 20-hectare land.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Things to do in Cologne (Köln) in 2023

sources.snippet: Home to over 10,000 animals representing around 700 species, the zoo offers a delightful experience for visitors of all ages. Don't miss the chance to explore the expansive Elephant Park and get lost in the wonders of the Rainforest Hall. This animal kingdom bonanza will leave you grinning from ear to ear.
sources.shortName: Cologne City Guide10 Must-Visit Hotspots

sources.snippet: If you both have a soft spot for animals, then the a trip to the Kölner Zoo, or Cologne Zoo, will be the perfect date to bond over your love for them!
sources.shortName: 20 Romantic Things To Do In Cologne For Couples [January 2025]

places.name: Cologne Zoo

reviews.text: What a lovely day out with great friends! Weather was cooperating and most of the animals were out and about! Some we did not see because they were hiding or somewhere else but there was still plenty others to see. We loved the dinosaurs too!  Stopped by the restaurant for some lunch which was also very nice. Lots of bees/wasps flying around while we were seated eating, so maybe not a great place if you are allergic, but otherwise really nice. Bathrooms were easy to find and it was easy getting in and out. Loved how playful the others were being! Thank you from the US!!

The 165th anniversary of Cologne Zoo is celebrated with evergreen content: dinosaurs.
But also with a Panini sticker album. So, if you want to give your children a treat, buy the Dino kombi ticket with the sticker album. Do so online to jump the queue on site. I highly recommend to also book the Dino VR experience in advance - it is a ten minute visual aid (in coop with local VR hero TimeRide) and adds to the animatronics dinos scattered throughout the park.
Otherwise, the 14 dinos add a nice distraction to the regular inhabitants of the lovely zoo. Some are animated, others really huge. One of the oldest zoos of Germany sports some nice attractions but also undergoes some considerable refurbishments. Some areas are closed off,  others are currently under construction (giraffe house).
But some historic buildings (old elephant house) surely add to the flavor.
We paid €98 for two adults and 2 kids. So plan to bring your healthy snacks and drinks with you, otherwise better top up your Amex ;)

Although zoos are not my favorite place to travel, this zoo surprised me. Animal rights were relatively respected and different and rare animals were collected in this zoo. I saw the Iranian cheetah, an endangered animal, for the first time in this zoo. It was a completely different experience from the zoos I had seen in Asia and Europe. I had it here.

places.generalDescription: Fühlinger See, located just outside Cologne, is a popular destination known for its picturesque lakes and a variety of water activities. The man-made beach offers a refreshing escape from city life and features amenities such as comfortable daybeds at the beach bar where visitors can relax under palm trees. Accessible by public transportation or bike, the area also hosts the well-known Summerjam Festival.

sources.snippet: But if you’re looking for a hidden gem, we recommend checking out Fühlinger See. This idyllic spot is located just outside the city center, and it’s perfect for an afternoon stroll or a picnic.
sources.shortName: Dates Ideas in Cologne: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Cologne

places.name: Fühlinger See

reviews.text:
An amazing place to spend a weekend with family and friends, able to swim and grill, sunbathing is possible too, toilets in reach and parking lot is available for the cost of 4€ for a day.
Best spot for being in nature with family
Nice place to chill, the water is clean due to the last few years of Corona.
Nice lake overall with lot of amenities and activities. Yet, there is a lot of trash in the beach and even in 2023 you have to pay cash for the parking..

places.generalDescription: Scenic wooded wildlife park with free-roaming animals, feed dispensers & walking paths.

sources.shortName: 20 Romantic Things To Do In Cologne For Couples [January 2025]

places.name: Wildlife park Dünnwald

reviews.text: A beautiful and quiet wild park , perfect for a stroll to clear your mind. There are coin machines with food to feed the animals.

A wild, expansive park in the middle of Cologne - a perfect spot for families with small children to enjoy nature and observe wild animals such as deer and boars.

The animals are kept safely behind fences, and there are automatic feeding stations near each enclosure where visitors can buy special treats to feed them.

Throughout the park, you'll also find beautiful wooden sculptures, plenty of benches, and small shelters where you can grab a bite or simply take a moment to rest.

There's a small play area for children too, featuring large tree trunks and small wooden huts designed just for kids to climb, explore, and play in.

One downside, however, is that the toilets were closed during the weekend - they are only available on weekdays, which I found quite disappointing. Given that the park is especially popular with families and young children, restroom facilities should ideally be accessible at all times.
Nice place to go for a walk with your family. It's kid friendly.

places.generalDescription: Sahila - The Restaurant offers a unique dining experience with a culinary journey inspired by various countries and cuisines. Guests are treated to a six-course meal prepared by talented chefs, including young up-and-coming chefs from Israel. The restaurant boasts one of the best wine lists in Germany, with experienced sommeliers providing perfectly coordinated recommendations. While the sommelier's guest interactions could use some improvement, the exceptional kitchen more than makes up for it.

sources.snippet: Don’t let the somewhat strange location of this one Michelin-star restaurant deter you from making a reservation. Sahila is my favorite date night restaurant that I’ve visited in 2023. It’s a total hidden gem – none of my foodie friends had even heard of it before!
sources.shortName: Best Cologne Restaurants For A Date Night Or Special Occasion
sources.siteName: Ausländer - An Expat’s Guide to Germany

places.name: Sahila - The Restaurant

reviews.text: Delicious set menu. Manageable portion sizes for the menu (I was able to enjoy the dishes until the last course). The experience is truly a journey around the world. Every dish was very balanced and innovative. Service was super friendly. Great wine selection and knowledgeable sommelier. The chef came to the dining room and spoke to every table. Highly recommend to go here!
Amazing meal excellent food 5 star service. Best meal experience in a long time . Sadly no such places in London . Met with Julia komp amazing talent .

I went there for my birthday. Great choice , great food and the service was Top! Very nice atmosphere and I will visit again .  One thing which was a bit off for me was the plant on the table . It was plastic and I personally don't like plastic plants 🌱. All in all , well done Sahila Resturant

places.generalDescription: Phaedra Restaurant, located in the Sudstadt neighborhood of Cologne, offers a delightful blend of Mediterranean cuisine with a touch of central European influence using locally sourced German ingredients. The restaurant's chic interior features industrial open shelves, contemporary art, and sleek furniture against a bright blue accent wall. The menu may not be extensive, but every dish is wonderfully flavorful and evokes scents from various Mediterranean regions. Visitors rave about the delicious and creative dishes, including freshly baked pita and appetizers.

sources.snippet: It took me a while to make it to this Südstadt neighborhood gem, but it was worth the wait!. The menu highlights Mediterranean dishes prepared with a central European flair and local German ingredients. Styled with a chic mixture of industrial open shelves, a bright blue accent wall, contemporary art and sleek furniture, Phaedra has a beautiful aesthetic that immediately puts you in the mood for a nice dinner.
sources.shortName: Best Cologne Restaurants For A Date Night Or Special Occasion
sources.siteName: Ausländer - An Expat’s Guide to Germany

places.name: phaedra Restaurant

reviews.text:
A Night to Remember at Phaedra Restaurant

Phaedra Restaurant provided the perfect setting for our Valentine's Day celebration. The ambiance was warm and inviting, and the décor exuded a touch of Mediterranean charm. We were warmly greeted by the staff, who were incredibly kind and professional throughout the entire evening.

For our special occasion, we opted for the Valentine's Day package, which offered a curated selection of exquisite dishes. The presentation of each course was visually stunning, and the flavors were an explosion of culinary artistry. From the melt-in-your-mouth appetizers to the decadent dessert, every bite was a testament to the chef's talent and passion.

While pictures can capture the beauty of the food, they simply cannot convey the full experience. The aroma of fresh herbs and spices, the delightful clinking of glasses, and the warm smiles of the staff all contributed to this unforgettable evening.

Phaedra Restaurant surpassed our expectations in every way. It wasn't just a meal; it was a sensory experience that left us feeling cherished and deeply satisfied. As my patner said, We will definitely be back soon, not just for special occasions, but to experience the magic of Phaedra again and again.

We had the 4 course menu. The tuna starter was amazing and the final steak/fish as well. In fact i think the steak was one of the best I ever had. The second course was a pasta that had an amazing sause but we think they lost the cooking point. We asked to return and the new one came the same way. Desert was not so nice either. Service was slow in comparison with other redtaurants. In summary we would return but not for the menu.

Even though there were vacant tables, everything was marked as reserved. Having traveled to several countries, I found this to be one of my least pleasant dining experiences. If guests are not welcome without a reservation, it would be better to communicate this more politely. Some of the comments made, such as “you don't need to come back,” were quite disappointing.

places.generalDescription: Glowing Rooms Cologne offers a unique and fun experience for couples, friends, and families. Upon arrival, guests are provided with 3D glasses, a putter, and a ball to play mini golf in blacklight rooms filled with neon signs. The diverse set of mini golf holes and 3D effects create an immersive experience across five themed rooms. While the place can get busy at times, it's still recommended as a great hangout spot for some psychedelic fun away from daily routines.

sources.snippet: Why not visit Glowing Rooms in Cologne if you’re looking for a fun, spontaneous date?. The idea behind this one-of-a-kind dating experience is to submerge you and your date in an environment that is fully lit by neon signs. When you arrive, you will be given 3D glasses, a putting stick, and a ball before you enter the blacklight rooms where you’ll play mini golf.
sources.shortName: Dates Ideas in Cologne: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Cologne

sources.snippet: At Glowing Rooms, it doesn't matter if you're not a pro golfer, because it's all about having fun and seeing if your date is up for a little friendly competition.
sources.shortName: 20 Romantic Things To Do In Cologne For Couples [January 2025]

places.name: Glowing Rooms Cologne

reviews.text:
We stumbled across this place by accident and so glad we did!
Friendly staff who spoke fluent English and were very helpful! 😁
Digital score card system was really cool. The rooms and 3D effects were out of this world! 🌍
Highly recommend if you're in Cologne! 🚀👾

Well organized, great place to hang out, and unique indoor concept! Must try at least once 🤩
Do confirm the slot, especially on weekends!
#IndoorFun #WeekendVibes #3dgolf
Holes are quite basic but the 3D effect and artwork are great, overall a good experience, staff spoke English too!

places.generalDescription: Seiberts - Classic Bar & Liquid Kitchen is a renowned establishment in Cologne, known for its vintage-style decor and exceptional cocktails. The bar's tiled courtyard filled with plants adds to its unique charm. It has gained international recognition and is considered one of the best bars globally, even making it into the book '150 Bars You Need to Visit Before You Die.' The ambience exudes a feel-good atmosphere with high ceilings, chandeliers, and original Chesterfield sofas.

sources.snippet: A short walk from Rudolf Platz train station, are two secret speakeasies: Rosebud and Seibert’s. Rosebud (Heinsbergstr, 20) is a stylish cocktail bar adorned with gold and red furnishings, low tables and stools for intimate conversations. The drinks are creative and well-priced.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Cologne

places.name: Seiberts - Classic Bar & Liquid Kitchen

reviews.text:
It is one of the nicest bars and they definitely deserve it.

It was a great experience! There is a glass door at the entrance and one needs to ring the bell to get in. Once let in, it is a cosy small place with stools at the bar and a couple of tables.

I ordered the Crown of Ginger Lemonade it was a gin based cocktail and was delicious.

I was sitting on a bar stool and got the honor to watch the bartenders create various cocktails. All of them looked appealing.

Prices are slightly elevated but I believe it's worth the experience. I would be happy to go there again.

A delightful surprise, recommended by a friend this was our first visit to Seiberts.  A cocktail bar that cocktail makers visit for pleasure. Seiberts has become our favourite place of all, in Köln. As a non drinker I am nearly always disappointed with the non alcoholic drinks offered but this is certainly not the case with Seiberts, amazing complex flavours beautifully presented at remarkably democratic prices.

A cozy cocktail bar with variety of options. The staffs are friendly and helpful. They give great recommendations if you are not sure what to choose. The atmosphere of the bar is nice and not too loud that people can enjoy a nice conversation.

places.generalDescription: Nestled by a serene pond, the Aachen Pond Beer Garden offers a delightful escape for those seeking a laid-back atmosphere. This charming spot serves up local favorites like sausages, schnitzel, and pretzels, all complemented by refreshing beers such as Gaffel Kölsch. With ample outdoor seating, it’s an ideal venue for casual gatherings with friends or romantic dates.

sources.snippet: When you're planning a date and want something easygoing and fun, a beer garden is the way to go. It's way more relaxed than a fancy restaurant, so you can just kick back and enjoy yourself.
sources.shortName: 20 Romantic Things To Do In Cologne For Couples [January 2025]

places.name: Aachen Pond Beer Garden

reviews.text: The pond next to this is freakin' beautiful. I didn't see any fish but I should really get in it next time!

Nice spot in the Aachener Weiher to grab a drink or meal in nice weather. Can get a bit crowded so things may take some time, but you're in a nice spot where you can savour the views while waiting.

Enjoyed the Flammkuchen, and would love to try some other variations although they only have 3 choices
Don't go here for the service. All we encountered were grumpy waiters. The location is top-notch though, so if you just want to laugh at people in the comfort of trees, it's good

places.generalDescription: Rheinpark, a sprawling 40-hectare urban oasis nestled along the right bank of the Rhine River in Cologne, is a must-visit destination for travelers. This historic park, established in the early 20th century and designated as a landmark, offers an array of attractions to suit every interest. From fountains and playgrounds to scenic jogging trails and picturesque picnic spots by the water's edge, Rheinpark enchants visitors with its natural beauty and rich history.

sources.snippet: Nothing could be more wonderful than a romantic walk through the Rheinpark. With 40 hectares and set along the banks of the Rhein, it provides a tranquil space in which to walk arm-in-arm and enjoy nature. The urban park has plenty of pathways and wonderful views of the Dom Cathedral, which sits opposite the river.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Cologne

sources.snippet: A protected urban oasis offering you green spaces, fountains, and playgrounds. It’s perfect for anyone on a trip to Cologne, including families and nature lovers. After reveling in Cologne’s vibrant array of attractions, why not uncover the city’s hidden gems and vintage wonders with our exclusive article Second-hand shopping in Cologne?
sources.shortName: 10 Very Best Things To Do In Cologne

sources.snippet: Voted as Germany’s best park in 2007, the Rheinpark is a relaxing parkland for the locals and tourists of Cologne. This park is spread across an enormous land of 40 hectares. It lies in the middle of the two districts of Cologne, Mülheim and Deutz.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Things to do in Cologne (Köln) in 2023

sources.snippet: Strolling hand in hand through the Rheinpark is one of the top things to do in Cologne for couples due to it being one of the most beautiful parks in Germany.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Cologne for Couples
Cool & Quirky Things to Do in Cologne in Two Days

places.name: Rheinpark

reviews.text: Great place for a day out, limited free parking, Toilets river view, kids area, cable car, kids train, picnic fun skating ramps

Very big and green park, great for families. There is a play area for kids and a steam train for kids. There is a nice cafe in the park which also allows for WC for 50 cents. The cafe surroundings are well maintained with pretty flower beds. The park has a nice view of the Rhein river overlooking the Cologne Cathedral. Pretty sunset view. Its a shame that the green grass lawn of the park was full of dog poo and we had to be very careful on grass not to stamp it.
Overall the park is nice and its worth visiting it.

Rheinpark Cologne is an absolute gem! This sprawling park offers something for everyone and is a must-visit when in Cologne. The views across the Rhine River towards the Cologne Cathedral and the old city are simply breathtaking – perfect for photos or just soaking in the scenery.
What I loved most was the sheer variety of things to do. You can take leisurely strolls or bike rides along the well-maintained paths, enjoy a picnic on the expansive lawns, or simply relax and watch the boats go by. There are also dedicated areas for sports, including beach volleyball courts and skate parks, making it a great place for active individuals.
For families, Rheinpark is fantastic. There are multiple playgrounds that cater to different age groups, keeping the little ones entertained for hours. The miniature railway is also a delightful experience for children (and adults!).
The park is beautifully landscaped with vibrant flowerbeds, mature trees providing ample shade, and even a Japanese garden offering a tranquil escape. It's clear that a lot of care and attention goes into maintaining this space.
Throughout the year, Rheinpark also hosts various events and festivals, adding to its appeal. Even on a regular day, the atmosphere is lively and welcoming.
Accessibility is also a strong point, with plenty of entrances and good public transport links.
Overall, Rheinpark Cologne is a fantastic urban oasis that provides a welcome respite from the city bustle. Whether you're a local or a tourist, spending time in this park is a truly enjoyable experience. Highly recommended!

places.generalDescription: Haus Müller is a charming restaurant located in Cologne, offering contemporary German cuisine in an elegant dining room adorned with plants and chandeliers. It's known for its elevated German dishes, deviating from the traditional pork schnitzel or fried pork knuckle. The location is described as pretty and cozy, making it a favorite neighborhood spot and a hidden gem in the area.

sources.snippet: This is one of my favorite neighborhood spots , tucked into a quiet cobblestone square off of Severinstraße. Haus Müller is a charming restaurant specializing in contemporary German cuisine. You’re not going to find pork schnitzel or fried pork knuckle here.
sources.shortName: Best Cologne Restaurants For A Date Night Or Special Occasion
sources.siteName: Ausländer - An Expat’s Guide to Germany

places.name: Haus Müller

reviews.text:
We had an unforgettable experience at Haus Müller, and we owe it all to Angelo and his incredible hospitality.

From the moment we arrived, Angelo made sure we felt right at home. He kindly offered us tastings of both white and red wine to help us decide which to start with, and he took the time to explain the menu in great detail, allowing us to make the best choices. The food and the atmosphere were absolutely amazing! The white wine was a perfect match, and the special menu beetroot dish was simply out of this world!

What truly stood out was Angelo's exceptional service. Despite the restaurant being fully booked, when 6 more friends suddenly joined us, Angelo worked his magic and managed to set up another table for us. Throughout the night, he was always there to help, from opening windows to accommodating more requests, including setting up a second table for an additional 8 guests.

It was our last night in Koln, and thanks to Angelo, it was made even more special. We can't thank him enough for his efforts and for making our evening so memorable.❤️

My best meal in cologne

The restaurant is located off the usual tourist spot of cologne but it is 'the' place that you should dine for exceptional food and atmosphere

Food
The restaurant serve local fare, but no not pork knuckle. They do have a good variety of options and seasonal menu. I trieed salad and ox cheek. Both are very good.

Atmosphere
Sitting outside with the wind blows on your face and the cathedral bell, what can be better than that. 🙂🙂🙂 this is prob the closest you can find a local life in cologne.

Service, nice and professional.

Verdict, its a must place if you are looking for exceptional food and local atmosphere.

I spent 50 euro for 1 starter, 1 main, 1 beer, 1 wine and 1 still water.
Very nice place, in a quiet neighborhood, superb service by a nice lady. Unfortunately, we didn't try the food. For sure we will next time.

places.generalDescription: Heumarkt is a well-known historical landmark located in Cologne, Germany. It features a spacious cobblestone plaza that is lined with cafes and restaurants, making it an ideal spot for entertainment and dining. The highlight of this location is the annual Christmas market, known as Weihnachtsmarkt Kolner Altstadt / Heimat der Heinzel which attracts many tourists during the holiday season.

sources.shortName: 20 Romantic Things To Do In Cologne For Couples [January 2025]

places.name: Heumarkt

reviews.text: I've been in this square a few days after New Year's Eve and the beautiful Christmas market that they build here annually was still there. You can find a lot of very nice wooden stalls selling drinks and food (the classics Bratwurst and Glühwein), but also some ice lanes where people play curling and a ice rink where children can ice skate.

First time visit to Cologne specifically for cathedral and Christmas market.  The market did not disappoint.  Plenty of food and drink choices along with authentic German holiday shopping.  Throughout market there were musicians dressed as Dickens characters, very cool!  Highly recommend visit...

Great fun Christmas market. My favourite out of all the ones in Cologne. There were gnomes everywhere. The ice skating was fun and not much of a queue. Really nice food stalls and a bar that had an upstairs looking out onto the ice rink

sources.snippet: Driving to Cologne is a great option as the city is well-connected to the rest of the country by the German autobahn. If you are driving from another country, you can take the A1 or A61 highways, which connect Cologne to the Netherlands and Belgium.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - A romantic day trip to Cologne, Germany

reviews.text: Easy to deal with Team, the car was affordable and in good nick, I chose the BMW M4 and had it for 10 days. It was a great experience. Thanks
Great service! Much recommended Dan and his team. Exempliory communcation and commitment to give the best customer service there is in this city.
Just came to Germany for travel and business stuff from Indonesia, and those cars really great. Keep it Up, I'll be back and I need ur Cars again 🙌🙏, thanks a lot!!!

places.generalDescription: The Lindt Chocolate Museum in Cologne offers a delightful journey through the history of chocolate, from its ancient origins with the Aztecs to its modern-day production. Situated by the waterfront, this museum showcases various exhibits that provide insight into the evolution of chocolate over time. It's a sweet escape for anyone with a love for all things chocolate and is definitely worth a visit while exploring Cologne.

sources.snippet: Chocolate must be the ultimate aphrodisiac so a museum dedicated to it is well worth a visit. The Chocolate Museum takes guests through the process of harvesting cocoa to the exquisite artistry of chocolatiers. Demonstrations of the process are given in the museum, as well as guided tours.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Cologne

sources.snippet: Having freshened up a bit, a great way to treat another one of your senses is to head to the Imhoff-Schokoladenmuseum. This fun yet educational attraction will teach you how chocolate is made, and you’ll even get some mouth-watering samples to try.
sources.shortName: 20 Things To Do In Cologne, Germany

sources.snippet: Indulge your sweet tooth at the Chocolate Museum, a delicious adventure on the banks of the Rhine. After your chocolate fix, retreat to the comfort of Ruby Ella on Hohenzollernring for a sweet ending to your day.
sources.shortName: Cologne City Guide10 Must-Visit Hotspots

sources.snippet: It's located on the River Rhine and offers a fascinating insight into chocolate and its history. Some boat tours allow you to hop off next to this sweet attraction.
sources.shortName: Cool & Quirky Things to Do in Cologne in Two Days
Things to do in Cologne : Museums and attractions
10 Very Best Things To Do In Cologne
20 Romantic Things To Do In Cologne For Couples [January 2025]

places.name: Lindt Chocolate Museum

reviews.text:
An absolute treat, from start to finish!

Visiting the chocolate museum was a truly great experience. Watching the entire process of how chocolate is made, step by step, through the different machines was fascinating. It's not just for kids… anyone who loves chocolate (or just enjoys seeing how things are made) will find it super interesting.

And of course, the freshly made chocolate tastings were the highlight!

Overall, it was an enjoyable, delicious, and educational visit. I'd absolutely recommend it to anyone, whether you're a tourist or a local looking for something a little different.

I liked the place but it's a little too expensive because the museum doesn't provide any cute or interesting activities for kids or visitors and not enough free chocolates. I paid 42€ and I feel like it was waste of money. In my opinion and as a chocolate lover I expected more  free chocolate samples for that price. Too much historical information and stuff nothing exciting or interesting. Maybe put some fun chocolate activities there.
The staff were nice by the way especially the lady with glasses who welcomed me at the front gate and provided some information about tickets etc she was so kind and funny and cute 😍

They were so accommodating! I had a 3:45 pm workshop but they let me see and visit the museum a head of time in the morning to avoid the crowds. I was blown away with the design of the museum. The depth and information how it was displayed was so well thought out and really made the experience all the worthwhile. Thank you for sharing all the samples of chocolate and I cannot wait to bring my little daughters some time from US! They would adore this as much as I did. I highly recommend the workshop too - such a fun experience even if it is in all German. The teacher spoke some English but was easy to follow along!

places.generalDescription: Ox & Klee, located in the heart of the impressive Kranhaus buildings by the Rhine River, offers a modern and airy setting for diners to enjoy inventive pan-European cuisine. Chef Daniel Gottschlich showcases his pioneering approach not only in his food but also in the non-alcoholic drink pairings offered alongside the nine-course dinner.

sources.snippet: For a very fancy date night that will change your conception of fine dining, Ox + Klee, the two Michelin star restaurant along the Rhine river, is a perfect choice. This remains one of my favorite meals in Cologne because I loved the way chefs Daniel Gottschlich & Erik Schmitz play with flavor. You can go behind the scenes of our experience with my TikTok video about our dinner here.
sources.shortName: Best Cologne Restaurants For A Date Night Or Special Occasion
sources.siteName: Ausländer - An Expat’s Guide to Germany

places.name: Ox & Klee - Köln

reviews.text: Amazing experience. We had a 6-course dinner, and everything was orchestrated perfectly. The dishes are something out of the ordinary, flavors we have never had in our lives and prepared with mastery. The service is impeccable and what we really like about this restaurant is the more relaxed atmosphere, without anything too fancy or that you don't feel comfortable in, you can really go dressed however you want and feel at home. The wine list is incredible, and they have an orange wine from Georgia that is simply perfect.

Ox & Klee in Cologne's iconic Rheinauhafen is a standout. Under chef Daniel Gottschlich's inspired vision, this two‑Michelin‑starred restaurant masterfully invites diners on a multisensory journey. Its “Experience Taste” menus-Ox (fish/meat) and Klee (vegetarian)-delight across six, eight, or twelve courses, each dish cleverly balancing sweet, sour, salty, bitter, fatty, and umami.

Housed in the modern Crane House No. 1 overlooking the Rhine, the space is tastefully pared‑back industrial chic-warm wood, clean lines, and relaxed, conversational service  . As Michelin notes, the ambiance reflects “lively chatter and lots of laughter,” blending top‑tier gastronomy with Cologne's easy‑going spirit  .

Highlights include a mackerel riff on Caesar salad-yellowtail, caviar, calamansi gel, anchovy bread crisps, Reypenaer cheese-and playful nods to local tradition like Halve Hahn  . Every bite exhibits thoughtful ingredient pairing and impeccable technique. The optional wine or non‑alcoholic pairings are equally imaginative.

Whether opting for meat or vegetarian, the entire dining experience feels artful yet unforgettable. A meal at Ox & Klee transcends a sumptuous feast-it's a cultural, sensory, and culinary celebration. For anyone visiting Cologne, it's not just a recommendation - it's essential.

5 Hours of Excellence – The Art of Taste

A beautifully designed concept where guests not only enjoy the food, but also learn how the chef balances flavors through carefully chosen ingredients and innovative techniques. Each dish is a true masterpiece. Service is impeccable, and the chef visiting the table to share the story behind the dish proves that 2-Michelin-star dining doesn't need to feel pretentious.

A highlight is the tribute to the city: the “Halve Hahn” course, leaving you with the taste of a Kölsch Brauhaus presented in a way you've never experienced before. The vegetarian menu is equally outstanding, and even those driving can enjoy a non-alcoholic pairing that complements each dish like an integral ingredient - perfectly in line with the philosophy of the Art of Taste.

Add to that a beautiful setting, and this was the easiest 5 stars I've ever given.

places.generalDescription: Nestled near the Cologne Zoo, Flora und Botanischer Garten Köln is a stunning botanical garden that spans over 11.5 hectares, showcasing an impressive array of more than 10,000 plant species from various climatic zones. Established in the mid-19th century, this lush oasis features magnificent trees and vibrant flower borders that create a picturesque setting for leisurely strolls. Visitors can explore enchanting glasshouses filled with exotic plants and enjoy tranquil ponds adorned with fountains.

sources.snippet: The Cologne Botanical Garden or Flora Cologne (Flora und Botanischer Garten) is a massive house of 10,000 species of flowers. This is the city’s oldest garden dating back to the 1860s. It is located close to the zoological park in Cologne’s Riehl district.
sources.shortName: 23 Best Things to do in Cologne (Köln) in 2023

places.name: Flora und Botanischer Garten Köln

reviews.text: Absolutely loved it! Even better than I thought it would be. Spring is obviously a great time to visit, the sun was shining and all the flowers were in full bloom. The gardens are massive and there are so many paths and different sections so it keeps it interesting as you're always seeing something new. It's incredible how many different species of plants they have.

Went to The Botanical Gardens on our last day as a chill experience. Used public transport to get there from the centre of Cologne and the trip was quick and efficient. The gardens are free to entry and are a brief walk away from the train terminal. You need to walk between the Zoo and Aquarium, this makes it a interesting excursion as you could also factor these in on your visit.

The gardens themselves were well maintained and beautiful. There are plenty of benches around for you to sit on to take in the beauty of the area. On our visit the cafe/bar wasn't open so would advise to bring some drinks/snacks with you depending on how long you intend to explore.

There are a couple of toilets around the site which cost 50 cents, these are clean and well maintained.

What a place! Huge park with an extraordinary amount of plants from all over the world. Beautifully taken care of. The flowers looked marvelous even in the August heat. A very calm place in the heart of a busy metropolis, I highly recommend it!
